messageBody:
On Monday 21 February 2005 10:43, Vamsee Kanakala wrote:
> Michael Schuerig wrote:
> >I'm using (easy)mocks most of the time, too. Now I'm in a situation
> >where I want to ensure that multiple DB operations (selects, create
> >temp tables, inserts, ...) happen in the same transaction, as only
> > then the code works properly. Are you using mocks in cases like
> > this? How?
>
> Hmm... I've never used mocks this way, but my ideas would be:
[snipped]

I've used mocks for this particular test suite where I had to mock
Connections, Statements, and ResultSets. It's been a lot of effort and
much too closely tied how the JDBC access classes (in Spring, not my
own) are implemented. I could have mocked at a somewhat higher level,
as you suggest, but then I wouldn't have been able to ensure that my
understanding of the workings of the JDBC access is correct.

All in all, it was much easier to test with a (almost -- in-memory) real
database and no mocks. See other thread for some details.

Michael
